{"step_by_step_thinking": "Based on the information provided in the documents, we can determine the type of joint that TMJ is. Document [9] states that the temporomandibular joints (TMJ) are the two joints connecting the jawbone to the skull. It is a bilateral synovial articulation between the temporal bone of the skull above and the mandible below. Therefore, TMJ is a synovial joint.", "answer_choice": "C. Synovial joint"}
